title: NAFLD (Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease) Activity Score
description: Diagnoses steatohepatitis based on histological findings in NAFLD patients. The NAS evaluates disease activity by scoring three histological features: steatosis, lobular inflammation, and hepatocellular ballooning.

parameters.name: steatosis
parameters.description: Percentage of hepatocytes containing fat droplets on liver biopsy

parameters.name: lobular_inflammation
parameters.description: Number of inflammatory foci per 200× microscopic field

parameters.name: ballooning
parameters.description: Hepatocellular ballooning (enlarged hepatocytes with rarefied cytoplasm)

ranges.interpretation: Score of 0 indicates no evidence of NAFLD activity. No steatosis, inflammation, or hepatocellular ballooning present.
NAS of 1-2 indicates mild NAFLD activity. Generally correlated with 'not NASH' diagnosis. Close monitoring recommended.
NAS of 3-5 indicates moderate NAFLD activity. Scores ≥4 have optimal sensitivity and specificity for predicting steatohepatitis. NAS ≥5 strongly correlates with 'definite NASH' diagnosis.
NAS of 6-8 indicates marked NAFLD activity. Strongly correlates with definite NASH diagnosis. Consider therapeutic intervention and close monitoring.

references: Kleiner DE, Brunt EM, Van Natta M, Behling C, Contos MJ, Cummings OW, et al. Design and validation of a histological scoring system for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. Hepatology. 2005 Jun;41(6):1313-21. doi: 10.1002/hep.20701.

Brunt EM, Kleiner DE, Wilson LA, Belt P, Neuschwander-Tetri BA; NASH Clinical Research Network (CRN). Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) activity score and the histopathologic diagnosis in NAFLD: distinct clinicopathologic meanings. Hepatology. 2011 Mar;53(3):810-20. doi: 10.1002/hep.24127.
formula: NAS = Steatosis score (0-3) + Lobular inflammation score (0-3) + Hepatocellular ballooning score (0-2)
notes: The NAS should not be used as a standalone diagnostic tool for NASH
A ≥2-point improvement in NAS is commonly used as an endpoint in clinical trials
Fibrosis is staged separately (0-4) and is not included in the NAS
NAS ≥4 is recommended for admission into interventional trials for NASH
